intro: Gymnosporia berberidacea, commonly known as the African barberry, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically red or orange in color. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some medicinal uses in traditional medicine. Gymnosporia berberidacea is adapted to arid environments and is drought-tolerant.
